sentences.sContent: You shouldn’t read other people’s mail.
sentences.sCn: 你不应该看别人的信件。

sentences.sContent: He found a mountain of mail waiting for him.
sentences.sCn: 他发现有堆积如山的邮件等着他处理。

sentences.sContent: She promised to forward my mail to my new address (= send it from your old home or office to your new one ) .
sentences.sCn: 她答应把我的邮件转寄到我的新地址。

sentences.sContent: He gets sacks of fan mail (= letters from people who admire him ) .
sentences.sCn: 他收到成堆仰慕者的来信。

sentences.sContent: ...Postmaster General Pat Donahoe announced plans to stop mail delivery on Saturdays...
...I’ll tell my secretary to put the paper in my mail box...
...We’ll send out the manuals this afternoon by express mail entirely at our cost...
...Direct mail A final advertising medium is direct mail...
...which uses mailings to consumers to communicate a client's message Direct mail includes newsletters...
...Direct mail is an effective way to build relationships with consumers...
...direct mail is the most effective from of advertising...

phrases.pCn: 邮寄；通过写信，通过邮递；按信件
每日邮报（英国伦敦的报刊）
n. 航空邮件；航空邮政
n. （美）垃圾邮件；邮寄宣传品
n. 直接邮件；直接邮寄广告
电子邮件系统；信件系统
优先邮件（美国邮政的邮件类型之一，在邮件分检系统内享有优先处理的特权）

words.tran: 装甲的；披甲的；有锁子甲状鳞的
邮寄；邮件；（苏格兰）农场租金
邮寄者；邮船；邮寄的广告；邮件收发机
邮寄；使披上铠甲的（mail的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: the letters and packages that are delivered to you
to send a letter or package to someone
